intro: Inversodicraea tchoutoi, commonly known as the Cameroon flame tree, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of western Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy red bracts that resemble flames. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its striking appearance, it is occasionally cultivated as an ornamental plant.
